Posts.Title: Post brachytherapy radiation and surgery effects Clangtl Irishgirl711

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2017 09:47PM kroop73 wrote: Happy Valentine's Day, ladies! Just thinking of all you brave, beautiful souls tonight. Hang in the fightingirl, the finish line is in sight! I had my balloon catheter implanted today. My type of catheter is called a mammo site. They made an incision, inserted the balloon and inflated it. I was put to sleep for the procedure. My BS said she left it open to drain. She gave me Levaquin to take for the duration of the rads. She also prescribed more pain meds. I have a surgical bra that zips and hooks in the front. I have one tube protruding from the incision with about 5 lead wires and 2 tubes (sorta like IV tubing) inside that tube. I go to the onco radiologist on thursday to have the placement checked and who knows what else. I will wear this bra for 10 days. I start the rads next week, Mon-Fri 20-24th. Now the interesting part begins..... how to sleep and sponge bathe. I will admit its tight, uncomfortable, itchy, and I'm in some pain. Thanks ladies for the encouragement. I will do my best to share my experience everyday. I encourage all of you as well to keep fighting the good fight! We will conquer! God Bless you all!
Posts.Title: Post brachytherapy radiation and surgery effects Clangtl Irishgirl711

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2017 01:49PM kroop73 wrote: Hi ladies, I hope all had a good day today with all your treatments and recovery. I got good news today from my surgery last Friday. My margin and lymph node is negative for cancer. Praise the Lord! Now we are ready to begin brachytherapy.... and we start the process tomorrow! My surgeon is going to place the balloon/catheter inside my breast where the lump was tomorrow morning at 7am. I will go to the Oncology radiologist on Thursday for ct scan and test to get me ready to begin. I will start on Monday 02/20 thru Friday 20/24. This is all happening so quickly! No time to slow up now.... I'm ready for this to be done! Hang in there ladies, we are survivors.... we will come out victorious! Thoughts and prayers with you all!
Posts.Title: Post brachytherapy radiation and surgery effects Clangtl Irishgirl711

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2017 10:55PM kroop73 wrote: Hahlyn, I had my lumpectomy on 12/8/16. We thought it was just a benign tumor. However, the pathology report said otherwise. They were able to use the exact same incision from the lumpectomy in Dec to remove the tissue from my breast. But the lymph node removal required a second incision, which is under my left arm pit. I am very sore with both but I believe the arm pit is just a little more sore than the breast. I wish you the best with your surgery. It is not that bad at all. I was only down about a week. I don't work a full time job so I was able to take it easy and go at my own pace. Sleeping was the hardest thing... trying to get comfortable. But again, it was only about a week or so of discomfort. You will do fine.... I will be praying for you! Let me know if you have other questions. We will get through it together! God Bless! Kandi

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2017 12:22AM kroop73 wrote: I had an out patient surgery to implant the balloon catheter inside my breast this morning. I will start balloon radiation next week, Feb 20-24. I see my Onco Radiologist Thursday for further testing before we start my rads. Now to try to figure out how to sleep and take a sponge bath with all my "new" accessories. Good luck and much prayers going out to all you brave women. We got this! God bless!

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2017 05:20PM kroop73 wrote: Hello ladies and sisters, I had my second surgery this past Friday 2/10. I had a lumpectomy on 12/8/16 (thinking the lump was benign). It wasn't and they didn't get a clear margin. So this past Friday, I had more breast tissue removed to obtain a clear margin and one lymph node removed. It appears from initial pathology done in the operating room that the node is clear of cancer. However, they have sent the tissue and node off for further testing. I have two incisions, one in the exact same place the lump was removed (bottom of my left breast) and another incision under my left armpit. I am doing well, holding my own with some soreness and little pain. I should know my pathology results by Tuesday 2/14. My surgeon did tell me that my oncotype dx number is 16 which is low and good. If the lymph node has no cancer cells, I will get to skip chemo. We are planning on brachyradiation (aka balloon radiation). I might be ready to start that in the next week or two. I thank God for every little piece of good news! Thanks for sharing your stories ladies! Its nice to be here to encourage and simply be here for one another. God Bless!
Posts.Title: January 2017 Surgery Group BeachBabyK Elem
